intro: Sanicula mexicana, commonly known as Mexican snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in shaded environments. It produces a fruit known as a schizocarp, which splits into two parts when mature. Sanicula mexicana is also noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
